Instruction: Rinse the quinoa under cold water.
In a saucepan, combine the rinsed quinoa and water.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes, or until the water is absorbed and the quinoa is cooked.
Remove from heat and let it cool slightly.
Meanwhile, zest the orange and squeeze out its juice.
In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, orange zest, orange juice, dried cranberries, chopped pecans, chopped green onion, olive oil, honey, and salt.
Toss until all ingredients are well combined and coated in the dressing.
Refrigerate the salad for at least 30 minutes before serving.
Serve the orange cranberry quinoa salad chilled as a nutritious and flavorful side dish.
